text: Konavade (Konvade) is a small village in Indian state of Maharashtrahttps://www.mapsofindia.com/villages/maharashtra/kolhapur/bhudargad/konvade.html. With population about 2500, Konavade is located near the Vedganga, a tributary of the Panchganga river. Farming is the primary business of most of the residents. Fertile soil, abundance of water and use of modern farming techniques along with advanced machineries have greatly influenced the farming and have helped to attain maximum productivity. The Animal husbandry as a side business also helps the people to earn some extra income. ==References== Category:Villages in Kolhapur district
title: Konavade
